definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate

sentences.english: I have taken physical exercise; now I must go at my lesson.
sentences.chinese: 我已經體育鍛煉過了，現在得溫習功課。

sentences.english: The exercise merely helps to impress that mental image on your subconscious mind.
sentences.chinese: 體育鍛煉只能幫助你將精神願景印入你的潛意識之中。

sentences.english: This includes eating healthily and exercising on a regular basis.
sentences.chinese: 這包括健康的飲食和常規的體育鍛煉。

sentences.english: Physical Activity, Adiposity, and Diabetes Risk in Middle-Aged and Older Chinese Population.
sentences.chinese: 中國中老年人體育鍛煉，肥胖，糖尿病風險。

sentences.english: Undergraduates can make better use of fields now available to participate in exercise.
sentences.chinese: 合肥市大學生能較好的利用現有的場地進行體育鍛煉。

sentences.english: Furthermore, some people are not clear about the differences between physical labor and sports training.
sentences.chinese: 部分羣衆對體力勞動和體育鍛煉這兩者混淆不清。

sentences.english: You should spend more time on sports.
sentences.chinese: 你應多花些時間進行體育鍛煉。

sentences.english: Doing exercise will lessen the danger of coming to the period of decline too early.
sentences.chinese: 體育鍛煉可以減少人們過早進入衰老期的危險。

sentences.english: Mental and physical exercise, for instance, both boost neuron survival.
sentences.chinese: 例如，腦力和體育鍛煉都被認爲能提升神經元存活率。

sentences.english: A  Concerning physical exercise, American men and women, boys and girls, generally fall into one of two categories.
sentences.chinese: 關於體育鍛煉，美國男女老少，基本上可分爲兩類。

sentences.english: Get the numbers on your scale out of the danger zone by being mindful about diet and exercise.
sentences.chinese: 請通過飲食和體育鍛煉讓你的體重遠離危險區。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is necessary for the students to strengthen sports and physical training .
sentences.chinese: 學生應加強勞動和體育鍛煉，促進機能指標的發育。

sentences.english: I donot reject moderate exercising, but it should not be over-exercised.
sentences.chinese: 我並不絕對反對適當的體育鍛煉。

sentences.english: The physical training will often reduce your blood to keep out the target.
sentences.chinese: 體育鍛煉往往會降低你的血搪指標。

sentences.english: Doing exercise can decrease the danger of coming to the period of decline too early.
sentences.chinese: 體育鍛煉可以減少人們過早進入衰老期的危險。

sentences.english: He tried to rejuvenate himself by performing physical exercises each day.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖每天進行體育鍛煉以使自己返老還童。

definition: to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)
to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges
parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes)/example/model/pacesetter
